commentary.line: Pakistan are just 105 runs behind Bangladesh's first innings total and the hosts need to play very well tomorrow to get back into this contest. That concludes proceedings for today. Join us back tomorrow for all the action from Day 3. Goodbye!

In reply, openers Mohammad Hafeez and Sami Aslam shared a fifty partnership before the latter was dismissed. Since then, Hafeez and Azhar Ali batted sensibly to put Pakistan in command. Hafeez recorded his 8th Test hundred - his 3rd in four innings - and also became the third Pakistani opener to amass 500 runs in 5 consecutive innings. Bangladesh dropped Azhar Ali twice and he is now looking strong after registering his 19th Test fifty.

Stumps, Day 2: Pakistan have had a great day in the office and they now have the upper hand in this Test match. Firstly, the bowlers bowled well in the morning session to pick wickets at regular intervals. Soon after the lunch break, Bangladesh were bowled out for 332. The hosts lost their last 7 wickets for just 96 runs as Wahab Riaz and Yasir Shah bagged two wickets apiece.

Sensibly, Bangladesh opt not to review

Welcome back for the post-tea session. The players are making their way out to the middle.

Tea, Day 2: Openers Mohammad Hafeez and Sami Aslam got Pakistan off to good start. Soon after the duo shared a fifty partnership, Taijul Islam removed the former. Azhar Ali then joined Hafeez and survived a few close moments before the latter completed his fifty. The spinners are getting some help from the pitch and the final session is going to be interesting. Take a short break and join us back in a short while for the final session.

Bangladesh have got a good first innings score but they were well placed to get more than 332. They lost their last 7 wickets for just 96 runs. Mominul Haque was top-scorer for the hosts, while Imrul Kayes too scored a fine fifty. Wahab Riaz and Yasir Shah bagged three wickets apiece, while Mohammad Hafeez and Zulfiqar Babar got two each. The pitch is very good to bat on and Bangladesh will have to bowl very well to restrict Pakistan.

Lunch, Day 2: Four wickets fell in the session and Pakistan will be very happy with their show. Bangladesh did not get off to the best of starts as Shakib Al Hasan played an uncharacteristic stroke to gift his wicket away to Zulfiqar Babar very early in the day. Debutant Soumya Sarkar then joined Mushfiqur Rahim and played positively. With the duo sharing a fifty partnership, Bangladesh looked all set to post a big first innings total but Asad Shafiq took an excellent catch to get rid of the latter. Yasir Shah then foxed Rahim with a big leg-spinner before knocking over Taijul Islam with a googly. Pakistan's fielding was much improved and the team management would be happy with their performance. Can the tailenders help Bangladesh get past 350? We'll find out after the break.

Pitch Report: "It's a straw coloured pitch. It's nicely rolled in, there is not much of grass. It will be easier to bat on today," reckons Aamer Sohail.
Even though there were a few dark clouds, the weather did not spoilsport yesterday. It is a bit cloudy at the moment and hopefully rain doesn't intervene today as well.

Hello and welcome to Day 2 of the Khulna Test. The morning session is going to be crucial for both teams. Pakistan need some early wickets to stop Bangladesh from getting a big first innings total. On the other hand, the hosts would want to bat well and score in excess of 400. Mominul Haque was the star performer with the bat for Bangladesh. He was dismissed against the run of play in the last over of the day yesterday. Pakistan's fielding was not up to the mark and the bowlers certainly need some help from the fielders as there is not much of assistance from the pitch.

Mominul continued and recorded his 8th Test fifty. In the process, he became only the 7th player to record 50+ scores in 10 consecutive Test matches. Just when it looked like Bangladesh had their noses slightly ahead, Zulfiqar Babar trapped Mominul plumb in front in the final over of the day to hurt the hosts. For Pakistan, Wahab Riaz, Mohammad Hafeez, Yasir Shah and Babar bagged a wicket each. The visitors dropped a few chances and they would want to improve their fielding. So that concludes proceedings. Join us back tomorrow for all the action from Day 2. Goodbye!

Opting to bat first, the hosts got off to a sedate start as the Pakistani pacers bowled a tight line. Yasir Shah came on and accounted for Tamim Iqbal in his second over. Mominul Haque and Imrul Kayes then batted sensibly to help Bangladesh get to 60/1 at lunch. Resuming after the break, the duo upped the ante but the latter fell soon after completing his 2nd Test fifty. Mahmudullah then joined Mominul and the duo were involved in a 95-run stand before the former fell one run short of a fifty.

Stumps, Day 1: 236/3 would have been better for Bangladesh, but they will take 236/4. Pakistan would have wanted a few more wickets, but they can be happy with the fact that they have not allowed Bangladesh to score freely. So it's all evenly balanced at the moment.

89.5   Babar to Mominul, out Lbw!! What a time to get a wicket. Mominul can't believe that he's been dismissed. Flighted delivery from Babar, Mominul looks to defend, but the ball spins sharply and goes past the bat. Hits him in line with middle and off and that looked absolutely plumb. Umpire Nigel Llong had no hesitation in his mind and he put his finger up in a flash. End of a gritty knock from the little man. He falls short of a well deserved hundred. Mominul lbw b Babar 80(162) [4s-8]
Babar to Mominul, THATS OUT!! Lbw!!

Mominul has been given OUT LBW, he consults with his partner and decides to review. That looked pretty out to me. Anyway, let's go through the process. No issues with Babar's footing. Looks like there is no inside edge as well. Hawk-Eye says hitting the stumps and the on-field call will stay.

Pakistan have reviewed for a catch after umpire Ranmore Martinesz shook his head. They seem very confident. No issues with Yasir Shah's footing. Was there an inside edge? There were two sounds. Is it bat hitting ground? No Snicko or Hot-Spot available. So this is going to be a tough call. There has to be enough evidence to overturn the onfield call. NOT OUT is the final call.
Shakib Al Hasan, left handed bat, comes to the crease

73.6   Riaz to Mahmudullah, out Caught by Sarfraz Ahmed!! Excellent catch by the keeper. Mahmudullah falls one short of a fifty. That is the end of a 95-run stand as well. Short of a length delivery just shaping away outside off stump, Mahmudullah is opened up by the movement, ends up poking at it and the ball takes a thick outside edge. Sarfraz dives to his right and takes a good one-handed catch. Mahmudullah c Sarfraz Ahmed b Riaz 49(123) [4s-6]

Welcome back for the final session. The players are out in the middle and we are all set for the action to begin.

Tea, Day 1: Good session for Bangladesh. They have scored 90 runs for the loss of Imrul Kayes in 29 overs. Mohammad Hafeez removed Kayes soon after the latter completed his second Test fifty and since then these two have shared a fine fifty partnership to keep Bangladesh going. Pakistan would want improve their fielding, having put down a few chances in this session. Take a break and join us back in a short while for the post-tea session.

Welcome back for the second session. The players are making their way out to the middle.

Lunch, Day 1: Bangladesh made slow progress on a good batting surface. Both Junaid Khan and Wahab Riaz bowled a tight spell up front to keep Tamim Iqbal and Imrul Kayes very calm. With the pitch offering some assistance to the spinners, Pakistan employed Mohammad Hafeez, Zulfiqar Babar and Yasir Shah into the attack. In the second half of the session, the hosts managed to pick up a few boundaries before Tamim was dismissed by Yasir Shah. The ball has just started to reverse a bit and it will be interesting to see the approach of the Bangladeshi batsmen against Junaid and Riaz. Take a break and join us back for what promises to a good post-lunch session.

26.6   Yasir Shah to Tamim, out Caught by Azhar Ali!! Finally, Pakistan have managed to break this opening stand. The umpire asks Tamim to wait as he wants to check the no-bal. Oh no! Has he overstepped? This is a very tight call. Is there anything just behind the line? That's a tough call, the line belongs the umpire. Probably there is something behind the line and he's given it OUT. Flighted delivery from Yasir Shah, Tamim looks to defend, gets an inside edge onto thigh pad, Azhar Ali dives forward at short leg and takes a good low catch. Yasir Shah strikes in his second over. Tamim c Azhar Ali b Yasir Shah 25(74) [4s-3]
Yasir Shah to Tamim, THATS OUT!! Caught!!

Teams:
Bangladesh (Playing XI): Tamim Iqbal, Imrul Kayes, Mominul Haque, Mahmudullah, Shakib Al Hasan, Mushfiqur Rahim(w/c), Soumya Sarkar, Shuvagata Hom, Taijul Islam, Rubel Hossain, Mohammad Shahid

Bangladesh have won the toss and have opted to bat

Pakistan will be delighted to see Misbah-ul-Haq and Younis Khan back in action again. Saeed Ajmal could play a Test match after eight months having got his bowling action cleared by the ICC. There are also a few other players who are returning to the Test fold. So overall, Pakistan would want to leave past results behind and start the Test series on a good note.

First a clean sweep of the ODI series and then a comprehensive win in the one-off T20I, Bangladesh have had a great time so far. With a lot of momentum behind them, can they win the 2-match Test series as well? Hello and a warm welcome to the first Test between Bangladesh and Pakistan in Khulna. The last time Bangladesh played a Test series at home, they beat Zimbabwe 3-0. However, this is going to be a tough challenge though.
Teams:

Pakistan (From): Mohammad Hafeez, Azhar Ali, Younis Khan, Misbah-ul-Haq(c), Asad Shafiq, Sarfraz Ahmed(w), Wahab Riaz, Yasir Shah, Saeed Ajmal, Zulfiqar Babar, Junaid Khan, Imran Khan, Babar Azam, Sami Aslam, Haris Sohail

Bangladesh (From): Tamim Iqbal, Imrul Kayes, Mominul Haque, Soumya Sarkar, Mahmudullah, Mushfiqur Rahim(c/w), Shakib Al Hasan, Shuvagata Hom, Jubair Hossain, Taijul Islam, Rubel Hossain, Mohammad Shahid, Litton Das, Shahadat Hossain
